summary:
Build the Level 1 subjective practice flow
  from JSON data with deterministic grading and immediate
  feedback, plus per-skill/overall accuracy and progress.
  Add schema validation and local attempt persistence
  with reset controls.
scope:
Level 1 skill list
  rendered as a tree-style list from JSON
  data

Subjective input with immediate correct/
  incorrect feedback and correct answer
  display

Accuracy and progress computed from the
  latest submission per problem (per-skill and
  overall)

Local persistence for attempts with reset
  per-skill and reset-all

Validation rules enforcing ID
  uniqueness, skill/problem relationships, and grading
  constraints
non_goals:
AI/semantic grading,
  partial credit, or explanation generation

Level 2+
  skills, prerequisite graph traversal, or adaptive
  sequencing

Login, cloud sync, or cross-device
  persistence

Automatic problem generation or external
  data imports

tickets.title:
Level 1 data schema,
  validation, and API delivery
tickets.description:
Define
  Pydantic schemas and validation for Level 1 Skill/
  Problem/Attempt data, ensure relationship/order/grading
  rules, and provide an API endpoint that returns the
  dataset or actionable validation errors; include JSON
  examples in docs.
acceptance_criteria:
Skill/
  Problem/Attempt/Grading schemas are defined and JSON
  examples are documented

Validation rejects missing
  skill_id/problem_id references, duplicate order per
  skill, and invalid grading mode/answer type

GET
  endpoint returns Level 1 dataset with HTTP 200 when
  data is valid

Invalid data returns a 4xx error with
  actionable IDs (skill_id/problem_id/order) in the
  payload

Backend tests cover missing skill, missing
  problem, duplicate order, and invalid grading mode
  cases and pass with make test
tdd_plan:
Red: write
  pytest cases for missing skill_id, missing problem_id,
  duplicate order per skill, and invalid grading mode/
  answer type

Red: add API test asserting validation
  errors include actionable IDs

Green: implement
  Pydantic schemas and a validator enforcing relationship
  and grading constraints

Green: add data loader and
  API route to return dataset or validation
  errors

Refactor: document JSON examples and keep
  validation helpers reusable

tickets.title:
Level 1 practice UI, grading,
  accuracy, and local storage
tickets.description:
Implement
  the skill list and problem screens, deterministic
  grading (numeric_equal/exact_string with
  normalization), accuracy/progress aggregation using
  latest attempts, and local persistence with reset
  actions.
acceptance_criteria:
Skill list screen
  shows overall accuracy (correct/attempted, %) and
  overall progress (attempted/total)

Each skill shows
  title, progress, and accuracy computed from latest
  attempts per problem

Problem screen shows prompt,
  input, submit, immediate feedback, and correct answer
  display

Grading supports numeric_equal and
  exact_string with trim/remove_spaces/remove_commas
  normalization

Attempts persist in localStorage across
  reloads; reset per-skill and reset-all clear attempts
  and update UI

Frontend tests cover grading rules and
  accuracy aggregation and pass with CI=1 npm test --
  --run
tdd_plan:
Red: add unit tests for
  normalization and grading (numeric_equal/exact_string
  with commas/spaces/decimals)

Red: add unit tests for
  accuracy aggregation using latest attempt per problem
  and per-skill/overall rollups

Red: add component test
  for skill list showing progress/accuracy from mocked
  data and localStorage

Green: implement grading
  helpers, attempt store, and aggregation logic

Green:
  build skill list and problem UI, wire data fetch, local
  persistence, and reset actions

risks:
Numeric parsing may accept
  unexpected formats unless strictly validated (e.g.,
  leading zeros, scientific notation)

Latest-attempt
  selection can be inconsistent across tabs without
  timestamps/versioning

LocalStorage schema changes may
  break existing attempts without migration

Data
  validation failures could block the UI if no graceful
  fallback is defined
